justification: Trade favors A’s preferences (upside WR, TE upgrade) but misreads B. B prefers healthy, consistent, consensus-ranked players; instead they’d get a Tier 4 WR and an Out RB, while giving up a Tier 2 WR and a rising TE. The rationale is generic and ignores B’s injury caution and consistency bias. Offer is mechanically feasible but not aligned with B’s incentives, making the stated 0.6 acceptance unlikely.
